column4: hey, ubuntu boots, after the ubuntu logo and orange loading bar, etc it says loading kernel, etc and everything, after the screen just goes black..and it stas lke that cd oesnt rnu or anything, etc. whats wrong with it?
i treid start with safe graphics mode too same thing
Are you using the Live CD or the installed version?
~[ natlinuxnewb ]~ i just pop the cd in, restart, and it bootes.
What monitor do you have?
~[ natlinuxnewb ]~ i just pop the cd in, restart, and it bootes.

hey, ubuntu boots, after the ubuntu logo and orange loading bar, etc it says loading kernel, etc and everything, after the screen just goes black..and it stas lke that cd oesnt rnu or anything, etc. whats wrong with it?
i treid start with safe graphics mode too same thing
What monitor are you using? Is this the first time its happened? Could you successfully load ubuntu before?
first time, no i never did load it successfully on tihs (tihs is a laptop) hp pavilion dv9000
Ok. Can you tell me the monitor type you have? Whats the make and model?
it's alaptop how can it have a Monitor make ? It's a HP pavilioon dv9000 thats what it says on the monitor it's a 17" widescreen
nvm i just read the laptop part :)
you HP laptop uses a NVIDIA GeForce Go 7200 card. Have you upgraded to the latest drivers?
~[ natlinuxnewb ]~ No, this use Nvidia GeForce Go 6150 -- Yes i have all updates installed, i did hp update and everything is good
Ok. my bad. was reading off a website. Good on the updating. What version is the linux CD?
~[ natlinuxnewb ]~ ubuntu-7.10-desktop-amd64.iso

Heres some reading for you. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=512059. Ill do some more searching see if theres anything about your specific problem. Reason I asked all those questions before was I had a black screen problem same place in one of my installations. What you have is different to mine prob but similar.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
Let us know if something helped in there?
